_comment: DO NOT EDIT: FILE GENERATED AUTOMATICALLY BY PELICAN PANEL
name: Nanos World
author: admin@example.com
description: Nanos World is a next-generation open-world multiplayer sandbox game built on Unreal Engine 5. This server supports both stable and bleeding-edge versions with extensive modding capabilities through packages and assets.

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
# Nanos World Server Installation Script
# Server Files: /mnt/server

## File: Pterodactyl Nanos World Egg - egg-nanos-world.json
## Author: Pelican Panel Community
## GitHub: https://github.com/pelican-eggs/games-steamcmd

# Update package lists and install dependencies
apt -y update

# Install appropriate dependencies based on architecture
if [ "$(dpkg --print-architecture)" == "amd64" ]; then
    # For 64-bit systems, install lib32gcc-s1 (replacement for lib32gcc1)
    apt -y --no-install-recommends install curl lib32gcc-s1 ca-certificates wget
else
    # For other architectures, install standard gcc libs
    apt -y --no-install-recommends install curl gcc ca-certificates wget
fi

# Install SteamCMD
cd /tmp
mkdir -p /mnt/server/steamcmd
cd /mnt/server/steamcmd

if [ "$(uname -m)" == "x86_64" ]; then
    echo "Downloading SteamCMD for Linux x64..."
    curl -sSL -o steamcmd_linux.tar.gz https://steamcdn-a.akamaihd.net/client/installer/steamcmd_linux.tar.gz
else
    echo "Architecture not supported for SteamCMD"
    exit 1
fi

tar -xzvf steamcmd_linux.tar.gz
rm steamcmd_linux.tar.gz

# Create server directory
mkdir -p /mnt/server
cd /mnt/server

## Install/Update Nanos World Server via SteamCMD
echo "Downloading Nanos World Server files via SteamCMD..."

# Determine branch based on version selection (default to stable)
BRANCH=""
echo "Installing stable version"

# Download server files using SteamCMD
/mnt/server/steamcmd/steamcmd.sh +force_install_dir /mnt/server +login anonymous +app_update 1936830 validate +quit

# Verify installation
if [ ! -f "/mnt/server/NanosWorldServer.sh" ]; then
    echo "ERROR: Server installation failed - NanosWorldServer.sh not found"
    exit 1
fi

# Make server executable
chmod +x /mnt/server/NanosWorldServer.sh
if [ -f "/mnt/server/Binaries/Linux/NanosWorldServer-Linux-Shipping" ]; then
    chmod +x /mnt/server/Binaries/Linux/NanosWorldServer-Linux-Shipping
fi

# Create necessary directories
mkdir -p /mnt/server/logs
mkdir -p /mnt/server/Packages
mkdir -p /mnt/server/Assets

# Clean up SteamCMD from server directory to save space
rm -rf /mnt/server/steamcmd

echo "Nanos World Server installation completed successfully!"
echo "Installation directory: /mnt/server"
echo "Executable: ./NanosWorldServer.sh"

variables.name: Auto Download
variables.description: Enable automatic download of packages and assets for players when they connect to the server.
